cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW, forecast to skirt Hispaniola, move across the southeastern Bahamas, then bend northwest toward south-central Florida and the northwestern Bahamas before lifting toward the Georgia/South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida coast near Broward/Palm Beach counties

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches presently limited to the central Bahamas (Cat Island, the Exumas, Long Island, Rum Cay, San Salvador)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings extend from Puerto Rico and the U.S./British Virgin Islands westward across all of Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Leeward Islands through Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, all Bahamas, and the Florida east coast northward to the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (35–45 kt) are possible at Port Everglades beginning late Friday night or early Saturday, with a 9% chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along the Broward coast if the center passes just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 3–6 inches locally, leading to brief street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-period operational interruptions due to lightning and squalls.
